result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion to Adjourn Hearing scheduled for 10/7/2022
Racine County Alternatives Program - Violation Report
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:12 AM Defendant Amanda M Galkowski in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg appeared by phone for Amanda M Galkowski.  Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates he was recently appointed. Defendant is seeking to modify her bond. Still needs time to obtain discovery. 
State objects to a bond modification in both of cases and provides arguments as to why. Provides email to Defense to request discovery. Puts offer on the record. 
BTC: Matter set over.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: DA Authorization to Defense to Obtain Copies of Certain Evidence

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive unless properly licensed.

1:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amanda M Galkowski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove in court for Amanda M Galkowski. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
